title: GMB's Charlotte Hawkins finally snaps at Piers Morgan as she tells him to 'zip it'
text:

Charlotte Hawkins finally snapped at co-star Piers Morgan on Good Morning Britain today as she told him to "zip it".

The 44-year-old had enough today when Piers interrupted her news segment and began criticising her wording, insinuating her comments to viewers were pointless.

Charlotte announced that there was some breaking news regarding Brexit and that viewers would find out new proposals this morning.

"Well what are they?" Piers asked, disgruntled.

"We don't know yet," Charlotte replied.

(Image: ITV)

"Well what's the breaking news then?" he continued to probe, prompting her to speak about what she had just said.

"The breaking news is that you don't know what it is," Piers retorted.

Charlotte exclaimed: "Nobody knows what it is apart from the prime minister and Arlene Foster at the moment!"

"It's like taking a camel to an Oasis and saying it can't take a drink," Piers replied.

The pair continued to argue as Piers accused her of "not knowing what the news actually is".

(Image: ITV)

"So there's really big breaking news everybody, we just can't tell you what it is," Piers mocked. "It's very exciting!"

Charlotte shook her head, visibly irritated.

She snapped: "I tell you what, there'll be a major incident here in the Good Morning Britain studio in a minute. Zip it!"

Piers seemed delighted with her anger, quipping: "Ooh, finally!"

"Stop butting it!" Charlotte exclaimed. "I'm trying to tell people about breaking news!"

Piers wasn't too happy earlier after a poll revealed that viewers want him to be axed from the programme.

(Image: ITV)

Over the last week, Piers has been faced with a petition to get him booted off the ITV show after ranting about gender and claiming he identified as a penguin.

Today, GMB decided to run a poll to see what viewers thought - and it didn't look good for Piers.

Only 41 per cent want Piers to stay while 59 per cent are desperate for him to leave.

Upon seeing the results, Piers was unimpressed and shook his head before making another plea for people to save his jobe.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

"We cannot let the snowflakes win!" he exclaimed. "We need you to get voting! Let's get these numbers up, let's get this vote back on track.

"Let's put the snowflakes firmly back in their box."

An hour later, however, the result didn't look much different, prompting Piers to say: "I'm in trouble folks, snowflakes are driving me out!"

(Image: ITV)

Piers was then involved in a fiery debate about whether he was transphobic and revealed that he had received the most "foul" abuse following the petition.

"Most people that consider the 100 genders thing is utterly ridiculous," he seethed as he hit out at an activist who had signed the petition to get him fired.

The presenter was left even more fuming when he was accused of being 'bigoted' for his views.

He added: "These are important issues we need to cover without being screamed at for having a different opinion."

*Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV
description: The Good Morning Britain presenter, 44, had enough today when Piers interrupted her news segment
